result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald R Niehus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Ronald R Niehus is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Ronald R Niehus was found guilty of Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry. Defendant may not possess pornography. Defendant may not use the internet without approval of Agent. Defendant may not have contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless approved in advance by Agent, however contact with children is allowed. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Niehus

3:08 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ronald R Niehus appeared in court. DOC agent N. Brierly appears by phone. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Matter is scheduled for review hearing on the no contact order with his significant other.
The agent would like to see the deft get several counseling sessions completed.
The agent indicates Deft has just started counseling.
The agent would like the deft to deal with past trauma and to better understand himself.
The deft's significant other has been apart of the violations the deft has committed and other individuals who are on supervision.
BTC: Will modify the no contact order on 3-15-22 as long as there are no other violations until then.

State believes conditions of supervision should be left up to the agent.
Victim and the deft have tried to get the no contact lifted through the agent but the agent has denied the request.
